election_record.label: Virginia 1811 State Senate, Class 1, District 2, Special

overview.note: "The committee reported that James Harrison had not been duly elected. A new election was ordered, and James Harrison won." The General Assembly of Virginia, July 30, 1619 - January 11, 1978; and, A Bicentennial Register of Members. Compiled by Cynthia Miller Leonard. Richmond, 1978.
This election held January 1, 1811, it is subsequent to the election held in 1810, but concerns the same state senatorial district and term as the 1810 election.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: "James Harrison 135 votes, G. Greene zero, First Day, James Harrison 142 votes, Grap Greene 10, Second Day" [NOTE: Votes for Harrison listed in the Poll book as 118, however, Polls names show 142 voting for Harrison.] Brunswick County Poll Book.

election_record.reference: Brunswick County Poll Book. Library of Virginia, Richmond.
Leonard, Cynthia Miller, ed. The General Assembly of Virginia, July 30, 1619 - January 11, 1978: A Bicentennial Register of Members. Richmond: Virginia State Library, 1978.
